location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 449: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: This letter concerns arrangements for British officers to land at Bushire without being detained. Samuel Hennell refers to a recent incident involving Lieutenant James Tronson, Commander of the HC brig of war, Euphrates,who was detained by sirbaz [foot soldiers] upon his arrival at Bushire. Hennell recounts his recent communications with the Sirteep, Moostufa Kooly Khan, who had been unaware that officers of the Naval Squadron were in the habit of landing and embarking at all hours. Hennell forwards details (not included) of an arrangement proposed by the Sirteep, whereby any officer wishing to land after sunset would be accompanied by two non-commissioned officers.
